definition: to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary
paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc

sentences.english: Movana Chen's main art production tools are magazines and the shredding machine.
sentences.chinese: 陳麗雲創作的主要工具是雜誌和碎紙機。

sentences.english: Get a paper shredder to dispose of important paper work.
sentences.chinese: 弄臺碎紙機處理重要文件。

sentences.english: Never wear loose clothes or hair when operating the shredder.
sentences.chinese: 操作碎紙機的時候不要穿寬鬆的衣服或者散發。

sentences.english: It is possible to buy new or second hand shredders and even refurbished ones.
sentences.chinese: 這是有可能購買新的或二手碎紙機，甚至翻新的。

sentences.english: There are rugged commercial paper shredders available that can macerate virtually any document.
sentences.chinese: 有堅固的商業碎紙機，可以提供幾乎任何漚文件。

sentences.english: As a result, commercial paper shredders are common in business of all sizes.
sentences.chinese: 因此，商業碎紙機是常見的商業的所有大小。

sentences.english: On most shredders, this ranges in size of about 8 to 18 inches.
sentences.chinese: 在大多數碎紙機，這一範圍的大小約8至18英寸。

sentences.english: A high-quality shredder can handle destruction duties.
sentences.chinese: 一個高品質的碎紙機可以完成文件銷燬工作。
